docs.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators have approved a new four-in-one combination pill to treat HIV, the virus that causes AIDS.

headline.main: Gilead's New Four-In-One HIV Pill, Genvoya, Wins US Approval
headline.print_headline: Gilead's New Four-In-One HIV Pill, Genvoya, Wins US Approval

docs.snippet: Federal regulators have approved a new four-in-one combination pill to treat HIV, the virus that causes AIDS.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was the first time in weeks Anthoula Papazoi had cooked meat. She had stewed the cut of beef, donated by a friend, on a low flame all morning. But now the casserole sat untouched, as Papazoi fretted about her 13-year-old daughter Nikoleta's tooth.

docs.lead_paragraph: Using naloxone, often known by the brand name Narcan, to stop an overdose on heroin or related painkillers called opioids is the first step in a complex process that can include hospitalization, treatment and relapse. Here's a step-by-step look at recovery, based on the accounts of first responders, harm reduction experts and health care providers:

docs.lead_paragraph: Preliminary testing of two long-acting injectable drugs indicates it might be possible to keep HIV at bay indefinitely with injections every month or two.

headline.main: J&J, ViiV: 2 Injections Every Month or 2 Could Control HIV
headline.print_headline: J&J, ViiV: 2 Injections Every Month or 2 Could Control HIV

docs.snippet: Preliminary testing of two long-acting injectable drugs indicates it might be possible to keep HIV at bay indefinitely with injections every month or two.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gina Kolata considers why the death rates for middle-aged white Americans are rising.

headline.main: More White People Die From Suicide and Substance Abuse: Why?

docs.snippet: Gina Kolata considers why the death rates for middle-aged white Americans are rising.

docs.lead_paragraph: Increases in mortality rates due to suicide and substance abuse rose in parallel with increasing reports of pain, poor health and distress.

headline.main: Death Rates Rising for Middle-Aged White Americans, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Rise in Deaths for U.S. Whites in Middle Age

docs.abstract: Princeton economists Angus Deaton and Anne Case find annual death rates among white middle-aged Americans are rising, unlike every other age, racial and ethnic group; poor education is viewed as crucial factor; death rates are being propelled by epidemic of suicides and sickness caused by substance abuse.
docs.snippet: Increases in mortality rates due to suicide and substance abuse rose in parallel with increasing reports of pain, poor health and distress.

headline.main: Questions and Answers about Veteran Suicides

docs.abstract: The Times had experts answer questions about the high suicide rates among veterans.
